website_summaries.verdict: The Thermashock cordierite is true to its name, and the No-Spill stopper comes in handy.
pros: This cordierite stone is on the larger side at 16 inches, and the No-Spill stopper keeps your pie from sliding off when you take it out of the oven
The stone heats evenly and is grill safe
cons: Like other cordierite stones, this one has a chemical odor

customer_reviews.title: Bad chemical oder and taste! I did NOT use soap on it.
customer_reviews.text: I've used the stone 3 times and it now has a strong oder that makes the food taste like chemicals and stinks up the house. I did NOT use soap on it, as the instructions state not to. I've had it a month and a half, so it is not returnable through Amazon. It is too bad, because the first two times I used it, the pizza crust was amazing. However, I do not recommend this stone, as the chemical taste is so bad I have to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: TLPH

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like this but...
customer_reviews.text: This does a nice job of cooking the pizza - nice even cooking. However there are two issues - one I can live with, one I cannot. The stone stains quickly which causes fresh pizza dough to stick to the burnt residue which increases the problem with each pizza cooked. But worse, the stone emits a foul odor that stinks up the house for hours after use. Need to burn candles, spray room spray and open windows. Maybe overtime that will eventually stop, but I am uncertain as to see if that is the case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy and inefficient
customer_reviews.text: It may be that this stone would work wonderfully well, but I'll never know. It is just far too heavy for me to use it comfortably. It weights about 9 pounds, without any food on it. And they recommend heating it for 30-45 minutes before adding the pizza. That seems like a waste of electricity for a pizza that only takes 12 minutes to cook on the open rack.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia O.

customer_reviews.title: Cracked after very little use
customer_reviews.text: We have used it less than 10 times and it has cracked. This was very surprising.
customer_reviews.author: Sunfish

customer_reviews.title: Brand new with a crack.
customer_reviews.text: Well, just took the pizza stone out of the box and there is a long crack going down the raised edge of the stone...back in the box! Update 7/31/2019: Replacement stone was also cracked in the same location. This is obviously a manufacturing/quality issue with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Hockey Nut

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pizza stone!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for cooking pizza on my grill. It works wonderfully. So well that I bought another one and can cook two pizzas at a time. I did not experience any of the smells other reviewers mentioned. I’ve put my nose to the stone before heating and smelled nothing and then after cooking at 450F, and still no odd smell, just stone and nicely done pizza. It cooks very evenly and I highly recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron G

customer_reviews.title: Very nice stone, good for 'large size' pizza from Papa M's
customer_reviews.text: I"ve done 4 take-and-bake pizzas since I received the stone...using my CampChef pellet grill on high. The bumper at the back of the stone works great to get the pizza on the peel. The varied thickness of the stone does seem to cook pizza more evenly too. The stone seems durable and I see no imperfections. The cookbook is part of the follow up email sent by the seller. The box the stone ships in only has an instruction flyer.
customer_reviews.author: John in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Oder - FOUL SMELLS
customer_reviews.text: This works like any other stone, but it DOES smell, after many uses it still emits a foul smell when used, it does not taint or cause the item cooked with smell, but it does linger throughout the house. Might be too late for me to return, DON'T purchase this item
customer_reviews.author: James D. Ragsdale

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this stone, however there are multiple flaws. The stone came packaged really nicely and securely, however the lip had deep cracks right out of the box. I decided to still give it a shot since the lip is only there to prevent the food from sliding off. Per the instructions I preheated the stone for a solid hour and then some, but the naan dough stuck to it no matter what. I was severely disappointed since the stone is really easy to handle and a good size for an average oven. Oh well, I'll try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Sania50

customer_reviews.title: Best Pizza Stone I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Excellent packing and shipping. Arrived in great condition. Easy to follow and understand instructions for using and cleaning. Truly makes a huge difference in heat distribution and retention in the oven. Even when not using this stone to cook on in the oven, I leave it in the oven on the lowest rack. It helps to maintain heat levels in the oven so there is less up and down or on and off of the heating action. Makes cooking at sustained temps much more stable. If you don't cook pizza at home, I would say to still get one to help all your other oven cooking!
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: A substantial  Pizza stone that really holds heat
customer_reviews.text: This is a very substantial pizza stone. Not thin like others iIve Had. The back raised lip is a nice touch to keep pizza and other food from sliding off when using a blade or spatula. Once it’s preheated no need for any direct heat from below when using a grill. It really holds temp because of its mass. It’s large so handles good sized pizza.
customer_reviews.author: CA winegrower

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love
customer_reviews.text: This stone is great! Our pizzas on our new Traeger smoker were amazing. Love the fact this has the bumper in the back so there is no chance of loosing pizza over the edge. Holds heat a long time. Great crisp crust. Also bought the pizza peel from this company and recommend getting the set.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: great and practical baking stone
customer_reviews.text: i have had a few stones over the years, but this is the best so far. it seems to pre-heat a bit quicker the others, and heat distribution is very good. the practical part is, firstly, the back lip which extends up enough to keep a loaf from sliding off the rack to the floor of the oven to then burn. the other is the shape, which is rectangular but the long edge is perpendicular to the back of the rack instead of sideways on the rack. i think this allows better air flow around the stone. oven pre-heat is quicker. very pleased with his product.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: It stinks!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife and we’ve used a number of times but can’t anymore. It makes our whole house smell aweful!! Some reviews said the smell has gone away but ours has gotten worse. This stone was not what we thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Shiester007

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: We've been very impressed with this pizza stone and it has definitely added another dimension to cooking pizza on our pellet grill! Provides a crispier crust without having to make any changes in the cooking process or risk burning the crust in an effort to do so. Easy to clean and care for and we're looking forward to using the stone to expand our baking "horizons" in the future by branching out into other types of food items! Highly recommended! And a great price and near instant delivery via Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Vernon

customer_reviews.title: Have some issues with sticking at first and strong odors ...
customer_reviews.text: Have some issues with sticking at first and strong odors. But I decided not to give up on it- and after quite a few bakes the strong smell went away and it doesn’t stick anymore. I prefer pampered chefs baking stone/ but this was a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Ssadie68

customer_reviews.title: A pizza stone every household needs
customer_reviews.text: Two years post-purchase and here I am, ready to review this pizza stone. My household is a bread and pizza-loving household. Buying this pizza stone was one of the best Amazon purchases we have made. We use it several times a week and it never fails us. Both pizza and bread bake Wonderfully, outside and inside, and the taste you get from the stone is a taste you wouldn't get from a regular pan or even from other stones made of different material. If you take proper care of it, i.e don't wash it with soap etc., it could last you a lifetime. Please buy it. Your taste buds will thank you later.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: delicious pizzas
customer_reviews.text: I chose this pizza stone because I had tried the brand's silicone pot holders and they turned out to feel really sturdy and long-lasting. Now I couldn't be happier with it: the stone is thick, resistant to changes from hot to cold and large enough for family pizzas, so I just have to make one for everybody and it always turns out the crunchiest we've tried. (I bought the entire combo by LTK: this stone with the Ultimate Pizza Peel as they had a nice discount when getting them together).
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: High functionality but low quality
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be great because of the size and the back that is meant to keep the pizza from falling off, but the back cracked BEFORE the first use just from being in the oven. It is very functional, but I don't expect it to last. I would like to have the same design with more sturdy material.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for making local bread It is important to make the oven hot to 550 degrees and inside the stone dish until it is ready to be baked
customer_reviews.author: Kareema

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: This stone regulates and disperses heat perfectly. The meals made on it so far have cooked beyond what I expected. The directions included for use, cleaning, and storage are simple and easy to follow. Packaging is protective and there were no damages during shipment. Mine did come with 3 or 4 small black streaks but they appear aesthetic and don't impact performance. While a minor annoyance, it's not worth removing a star. I'd buy it again in a few years if it ever gets damaged. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate Pizza Stone Is Right!!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love my pizza stone!!! Never was a big pizza fan, but since I've been making my own and using my awesome pizza stone, I have found a newfound affections for pizza. Who knew! A board scraper is a very helpful tool to use with your pizza stone, if you get oozing cheese stuck to it, as you don't want to wash it with soap. The stone stays very hot for a while after it comes out of the oven, so you can eat two hot pieces at the same sitting, a plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S. Trapp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stone!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stone!! Best pizza ever. I just bought some premise dough from publix and it turned out excellent. You must put the stone on a cold grill or in a cold oven and then preheat, I read some experienced cracking and that may be the reason why. Great quality and packaging too. I highly reccomend this stone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie galbo

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Would strongly recommend avoiding this product. Stone continues to give off chemical smell with every use - the entire house smells of burning chemicals. Only get this smell when using this product. We now have serious concerns there are off-gasses contaminating the food coming into contact with the stone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Great Pizza Stone
customer_reviews.text: Replaced another stone with this one. Much better. Heavy, heats uniformly, browns crust evenly, can get a nice size pizza on it without it hanging over the edge, clean-up is a breeze and really like the handle/stop in the back as it really does stop toppings from sliding off when you are putting the pizza on it from a peel. Highly recommend this quality pizza stone.
customer_reviews.author: Jack M.

customer_reviews.title: Just used once and will never use another stone. Perfeft for pizza, bread or rolls
customer_reviews.text: Loved the back edge in case of over loaded pizza toppings, can't fall over into bottom of oven, Great Idea! Our pizzas were crusted and delicious! ymmmie
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use, almost too big
customer_reviews.text: We had been using metal pans that warped with the high heat (500 degrees) and so I wanted something that was heat resistant. This definitely works! The crust was nice and crunchy (I cooked it for 9 minutes, next time I will do 10 for even more crunch) and there was no chemical smell or taste like other reviews I've seen. With the stopper pressed against the back of my oven, the pizza stone was too big and stuck out, I wasn't able to shut the oven door. So we had to turn the stopper part to the side in order for the stone to fit. It still works, and is very helpful with getting the pizza out!
customer_reviews.author: Jon L.

customer_reviews.title: Defect, fine fractures on stone just like other reviewers pics.
customer_reviews.text: Reviewers posting pictures of fractures on the pizza stone is exactly what I got right out of the box. It looks like a stress fracture/ manufacture defect. It likely will not make a difference in terms of performance but I'm concerned the piece will eventually break along the fracture through normal wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: The DL

customer_reviews.title: Cracked
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to bake flat bread as soon as I get this stone, just got it and it's cracked
customer_reviews.author: Very Picky

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: Tried this one because it was cheaper and more accessible than buying a Pampered Chef one - This one is HEAVY and I have to hold it with both hands. Uncomfortable and heavy. Almost too big for a standard rage/oven. Personally, I don't recommend and I would not purchase again. I like the Pampered Chef one better. (Jen E.)
customer_reviews.author: James E Estep

customer_reviews.title: Great Pizza Stone for Green Egg!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t often write reviews but this is where it’s at. I make pizza on my large green egg. My last stone shattered when I was trying to get the pizza off with my peel. The pizza slid off the side and the toppings fell onto the stone which made it shatter. This stone is about twice as thick as my other one. It is very study and spreads heat well. The pizza stop on this is awesome and is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Greinert

customer_reviews.title: Pizza stone didn’t last 4 cooks before it started to crack
customer_reviews.text: I love the way this stone cooks pizzas, and the peel is a must have; however, I’ve only used this a few times in the 3 weeks I’ve had it, and it already has a crack in it! I really expected it to last longer than it did. ***UPDATE*** I emailed the seller and they responded quickly. After a few emails, they are sending me a replacement stone. This company understands customer service, and I'd happily do business with them again. I'm changing my original 1 star rating to 4 stars. Their customer service is 5 stars, but the product did still crack within the first month of use.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Adams

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Have threatened to get a pizza stone for a long time since I have tasted pizzas that were baked on one. Bought this one because the size was ample for my needs, but particularly because it has a lip at the back that keeps you from pushing your pizza off the back while trying to remove it. Have only used it once so far, but will no doubt be giving it more use. Am anxious to try baking a crusty loaf of bread on it.
customer_reviews.author: BobQ

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: We've gotten a lot of use out of this stone. It makes great pizza. It got dirty, and I tried to clean it with a steel wool pad which was a BAD idea because I scratched up the surface. Only use a soft sponge (and no soap). Just learn to live with the baked-in stains as they accumulate. It gives the stone character.
customer_reviews.author: Koolbuys

customer_reviews.title: Large stone with clever backstop
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this stone after reading lots of reviews. We really liked the large size and the “backstop” that keeps pizzas from scooting off the stone when sliding them on or off. It worked as advertised and everyone loved the pizzas. We haven’t tried the recipes that the seller emailed after purchase but they look promising.
customer_reviews.author: M. Moreland

customer_reviews.title: We use it at least once a week
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This thing works great. My kids stopped ordering pizza once we got this pizza stone, because they can make it better, faster and with exactly the ingredients they want. Cooks evenly - makes perfect pizza. I'm not sure why I didn't order it YEARS ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to use and clean - DO NOT USE SOAP; there will be NO smell
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive to buy this product after reading reviews that people got soapy or chemical smells, then I looked at other products and saw that recurring. Finally I bought this one. I've had NO issues with soap or chemical smells. It works beautifully! I cook mine on a komodo grill, so heat it up to about 600-650 and cook a pizza in 4 minutes. I use only water to clean it off if that. Heat is really the best to let clean the stone.
customer_reviews.author: Rick in Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: The best pizza Stone!
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this a superior pizza stone to others I have owned in the past but their customer service and feedback makes them the clear winner in a crowded field. To top it off, I especially like the back stop on the Stone.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Nagasugi

customer_reviews.title: Buy it NOW
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband whom had been begging me to get a stone for the past year now we use this pizza stone once a week. I love slicing a pizza in 4 easy cuts and I cant imagine trying to remove a pizza from the stone without the paddle. If you are thinking about getting a pizza stone get the package it is so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Use corn meal!
customer_reviews.text: You need to use something like corn meal on both the peel and the stone, or the dough will stick. I've only made fresh pizzas on this, never frozen. With the corn meal, this is the dream! Without, it's a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Boudewijn R.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: love, love, love this stone, works great, cleans up easier than my other type of stone. The lip in the back is why i bought the stone and it does its job!
customer_reviews.author: CoInAZ

customer_reviews.title: Sticks to everything.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions for cooking and cleaning. It ended up with burn stains and food sticks to it.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Came broken
customer_reviews.text: My daughter in law opened her gift and this is what she found inside. Not happy at all
customer_reviews.author: Robert Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Great pizza
customer_reviews.text: Barely fits my Wolf oven. Will not fit on lower or middle rack. I have to use the top rack and then place the stone over the tack lip in the far back for the stone to fit and close the oven door. Not the stone quality as an issue as it more of a problem in theoven design. I very much like the stone.
customer_reviews.author: Honukane

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We have used the pizza stone once, and it was a huge hit. There was no weird smell like others have said. I suggest following the instructions and your pizza will turn out wonderfully! The key is store the stone in the oven, then bringing it to temperature in the oven and transferring your pizza onto it.
customer_reviews.author: Lace

customer_reviews.title: This Is the One to Buy.
customer_reviews.text: After having a previous pizza stone self destruct when heated to 500 degrees, I did a few days of research for a replacement and found this. Perfect. No odor, as some complained. I washed it before using and dried it in the oven. My first pizza was a pleasure to bake on this large thick stone. And the handle is a great help when I want to rotate my pie halfway through baking. I can’t imagine a better pizza stone!
customer_reviews.author: Potato Eater

customer_reviews.title: I love this Pizza Stone
customer_reviews.text: I love this Pizza Stone. We have used it on our grill and what great job it does. We hope to cook many Pizza on this Stone for many years. The only disappointment is that we did not receive the 108 page cook book that that was supposed to come with it. I sure wish that they would send us our book. Thanks R W.
customer_reviews.author: Roulf W Warrington

customer_reviews.title: What you didn’t know you needed!
customer_reviews.text: Since you don’t clean the stone in a traditional sense, I am entertained that I am being asked to review it in that light. Read the instruction manual and you will be set! I have used mine several times and originally bought it to cook homemade pizza on it but I have not been able to do that just yet. Frozen pizzas on it have been great!
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: ... pizza stone for the first time and it was perfect. The stone is the absolute right size for ...
customer_reviews.text: I made crusty bread on my new pizza stone for the first time and it was perfect. The stone is the absolute right size for my oven and is easy to insert and remove when needed. I dropped some oil onto the stone by accident and i think it might be a permanent stain. Be careful about that. Looking forward to more great breads and pizzas.
customer_reviews.author: mama ro

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought this , cost a bit more than some but worth it ! Thicker and MUCH more durable than ones I've had in the past . I actually dropped it and it survived !! The only issue was my fault , I didn't measure my Jenn Air oven before ordering ....the stone fits but barely ! GREAT product HIGHLY RECOMMEND .
customer_reviews.author: Bill H.

customer_reviews.title: Durable stone with edge to grasp.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot comment on cleaning because I have not used it. I love this stone and am eager to try. I had hoped to use it on my new Green Egg but Imhave a medium Big Green Egg and even though it’s diameter is 16 inches this stone is slightly too large. I will use in my oven.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie J

customer_reviews.title: Beginners Be Aware
customer_reviews.text: There’s a learning curve with the stone and peel. It’s great once you get the dough consistency and transfer from peel to stone and back, so good luck.
customer_reviews.author: AK_Vance

customer_reviews.title: Weird Smell out of the box
customer_reviews.text: There is a weird smell out of the box. I put in the oven @425 degrees for about 2 hours. I let it cool naturally and the smell has seemed to go away.
customer_reviews.author: SeaMike

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stone
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. This is a heavy duty stone. I'm not thrilled with the ridiculous back stop, but the stone is thick and seems to work nice. My last stone was a third as thick and lasted 10 years! I always wanted a thicker one, thinking it would absorb and radiate more heat when loaded.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Venditto

customer_reviews.title: Pizza stone
customer_reviews.text: The stone does make the pizza crust nice and crispy. Only negative is the weight of the stone, very heavy. The stone cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy Watson

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend the Ultimate Pizza Stone
customer_reviews.text: My family loves the pizza cooked on this stone. We've used both in the oven and on the grill with superb results. The raised area on the side is an ingenious idea. It makes pizza removal spillproof. I highly recommend the Ultimate Pizza Stone.
customer_reviews.author: K. Chiles

customer_reviews.title: Best pizza stone. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been making pizza for years - first on a crate and barrel stone and then pampered chef. Both were great - but this one is AMAZING. Seriously y’all. No oil/flour needed, its huge, and so sturdy. The pizza we made on this - same method, ingredients, etc we’ve been doing for years - was far and away better than any other pizza we’ve ever made!
customer_reviews.author: Katelin

customer_reviews.title: Good grilling pizza stone
customer_reviews.text: Nice stone- but be sure to measure the functional width of your grill surface to make sure lid can close (barelY fits with Weber Genesis grill)
customer_reviews.author: MMS Sr

customer_reviews.title: Best Little Pizza Stone
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this pizza stone. Especially love the back 'guard' on the stone, which aids in setting down and picking up the pizzas.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Smells bad
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this pizza stone but I can not. After frequent uses over several months, the stone still smells really really bad. It makes my entire house smell like chemicals every time it is heated. I am so very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carla M.

customer_reviews.title: Bought two.  Both cracked
customer_reviews.text: Look this over carefully. I sent two of these back because they had cracks along the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Rees

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have used the stone twice and it performs well. The only problem is it is almost too large for my oven rack. I assumed ovens were standard sizes. I recommend measuring before purchasing the stone.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Stone Great - Paddle...eh.
customer_reviews.text: The Stone works great but the paddle not so great. Everything sticks to it. I should have stuck with a wooden paddle.
customer_reviews.author: K. Christie

customer_reviews.title: Pizza Stone
customer_reviews.text: Works well but not sure if it is any better than using some of the cheaper metal pizza pans. Stains easily from any oil in the pizza
customer_reviews.author: DaveFL

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, though the stone was too large for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, though the stone was too large for our oven and we sent this one back and exchanged for a different size.
customer_reviews.author: ggrewe

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: ...awesome pizza stone. Cooks fairly quickly. Wish you could load your pizza on before you add toppings, transfer is always tricky. But overall great stone.
customer_reviews.author: kdubb73

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for XL Pizza!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stone pizza pan. Pizza cooked all the way through with LOTS of flavor. I would definitely buy again but it’s pretty sturdy and looks like it’ll last me forever. I’ll definitely gift to family, friends and pizza lovers!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Check it out once it arrives
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a crack all along the back stopper. Will return and give it a try again. Just the hassle of returning and waiting for a new one is a pain. What kind of quality control do they have?
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Hollander

customer_reviews.title: to thick
customer_reviews.text: I need to find a thinner one, this one is way to thick and haven't been able to get a crunchy pizza crust off it.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Pizza Time!
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be a very good quality stone. Time will tell. First pizza came out good, but some adjustments are needed to improve crust crispiness. Its a good size stone so will make plenty of pizza.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy making pizza at home. I bought this with all the extras and I am very pleased. Pizza stone is sturdy and cutter works fantastic. Very pleased with this product. It also arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the set to get!
customer_reviews.text: We love this pizza stone and peel set. It’s sturdy, heats fast, it’s very well made and thick, and we just keep it in the bottom of the oven. We do pizza night much more often now!
customer_reviews.author: Heisenberg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: The pizza stone gives off a Awful smell when in the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary H.

customer_reviews.title: A square ceramice pizza plate.. why?
customer_reviews.text: The product works well for cookies and pasties and such, but it's useless for a pizza. Pizzas are almost always round. This is putting a round peg into a square hole. Buy a round pizza stone, this one is now for decoration for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Stone
customer_reviews.text: Now this is an awesome Pizza Stone It hasnt broken due to quick temp changes and it makes Great pizza on the grill. I’m using it on the Kamado Acorn!
customer_reviews.author: Isaac G.

customer_reviews.title: Broke item
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, received it broke I have already waited long enough for it, will be another 3 weeks if I send it back would not recommend,
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: product came with a crack
customer_reviews.text: very simple, all shipping wraps were good, but the ceramic plate has a big crack one it.
customer_reviews.author: Zhuo Bao

customer_reviews.title: Crunch and no bad smell at all
customer_reviews.text: Love it after the first time I used it. It gives better pizza bread or any bread I make on it. It does not have any smell! It’s heavy tho. Heat it up fast and evenly. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Little horse

customer_reviews.title: Thick and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love this stone, it is plenty big to hold the pizza or cook other items ontop, which benefit from the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We like it far more than the ones without the backstop
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a large pizza. Love the backstop that keeps a pizza in place when pushing a peel under it. Nice heavy weight stone. Easy to brush clean.
